title: Adele and Lady Gaga pose together in the sassiest snap from the Grammys
text:
Adele and Lady Gaga pose together in the sassiest snap from the Grammys The pair had both delivered epic performances – for very different reasons Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Adele shows Beyonce love as she wins big at the Grammys Share this video   
Just how much slay is one photo allowed to hold? This one of Adele and Lady Gaga might just be illegal, as it's far too sassy to handle. 
The two queens of pop posed together at last night's 2017 Grammy Awards, where they both performed – and no doubt bonded over the technical difficulties they both suffered. 
Adele had had to halt her tribute to George Michael when she realised she was singing in the wrong key, and stopped part-way through her performance of Fast Love to apologise to the audience. Adele had asked for her tribute to George Michael to be restarted (Photo: Getty) She looked upset as she realised she was singing in the wrong key (Photo: Getty Images North America) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Adele breaks down and swears during George Michael tribute Share this video Watch Next 
She got emotional and swore as the assembled A-listers clapped and cheered her commitment to doing the best job she could, especially as, in her words, she didn't want to "get it wrong" for George. 
Meanwhile, Gaga was beset with problems too as her co-stars Metallica couldn't be heard for the first few moments of their set. 
Frontman James Hetfield looked annoyed as his microphone failed to pick up his words, so he was forced to share Gaga's until his own could be fixed. 
Not only that, but Metallica were entirely left out when Laverne Cox introduced their set but spoke only of Lady Gaga, prompting outrage from the band's fans on Twitter. 
Earlier in the evening, Adele had paid tribute to her musical idol Beyonce after scooping her to the Album of the Year award. Adele and Beyonce go back a long way - here they are at the Grammy Awards in 2013 
In a tearful acceptance speech, Adele – who has previously praised Beyonce for her work – said she couldn't possibly accept the award because Bey was a more deserving winner. 
"The artist of my life is Beyonce and the Lemonade album was just so monumental, Beyonce, and so well thought out and so beautiful and soul-baring," she told her mentor. 
"And we all got to see another side to you that you don't always let us see, and we appreciate that. And all us artists here, we f**king adore you, you are our light. And the way you make my friends feel, the way you make my black friends feel is empowering, and you make them stand up for themselves. I love you, I always have and I always will." Adele paid tribute to her icon, Beyonce (Photo: REUTERS) She later spoke to Jay Z (Photo: Getty Images North America) The two embraced after Adele won five gongs at the awards ceremony (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
Beyonce looked visibly moved by Adele's message and mouthed "I love you" back at her while husband Jay Z stood by her side. Like us on Facebook
